newsitem.title: USA: CSCE begins trading butter options Tuesday.
newsitem.headline: CSCE begins trading butter options Tuesday.

text.p: The Coffee, Cocoa and Sugar Exchange Inc (CSCE) launched its butter options contracts Tuesday morning, but no trades were posted, the CSCE said.
The options contract, which trades from 0900 to 1400 EDT, is based on the CSCE's butter futures contract introduced on October 15.

The underlying futures contract calls for FOB delivery of USDA Grade AA "fresh" or "storage" salted butter at any point within the continental U.S. The trading unit is 10,000 lbs, with a delivery unit of 40,000 lbs. Price quotation is in cents per lb, with delivery months of February, April, June, August, October and December. The ticker symbol is BW.
The CSCE reported no trades on the futures contract Tuesday.
